TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {65592=Since this is my last show for 2012, our Chinese Word of the Day is 再见 - "goodbye", but literally "see again"! It is pronounced "zàijiàn"~ See you guys again next semester, and thank you for tuning in to Wok n' Roll!}
textBeforeTable: -DJ mimop In honor of this being my actual LAST SHOW EVER, my final Word of the Day is 안녕~~ 안녕 is pronounced "annyeong" and means both "goodbye" and "hello"! 안녕 listeners~~~ love you~~~~ May 7, 2014 Show Shows Wok n' Roll pays tribute to East Asian music and culture every Thursday at midnight. It's all genres of music from East Asia, like South Korean pop and hip-hop, Chinese pop, Japanese rock, Mongolian throat music, and songs in which artists sing in different languages (like Koreans singing in Chinese). Through the Word of the Day, I teach Japanese, Chinese, and Korean words. Wok n' Roll presents a blend of the best of East Asian music from past to present! Next show: July 31, 2015 Wednesdays at 5:37 PM Wok n' Roll DJ_momo Host // ]]> --> OA_show('OpenX - Button B2'); OA_show('OpenX - Button B1');
textAfterTable: Our Chinese Word of the Day is 期末考试 - "final exam"! It is pronounced "qímò kǎoshì". Good luck on all your 期末考试! Also this is apparently my last show EVER as a radio DJ. Thanks everyone for listening and I love you - 我爱你 , 사랑해 , 愛してる !!!!!
